column4: hey guys i need some help i have a computer with 1 hard drive with windows vista on it and i want to put my other hard drive which has xp and ubuntu on it now i was wondering.. will the grub bootloader take over the vista one?
it depends how your bios treats the drive. If you hook it up as a secondary/slave drive it should boot the master first.
Some bioses behave wierdly though and just choose a drive that makes no sense.
it would just boot vista and ignore grub.
if you want ubuntu you can have hte ubuntu/xp drive as a the master and just add vista in grub.
